summary: This document is an email chain from October 2019 between attorney Gloria Allred, an FBI agent, and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding a new alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein who is willing to attend a victim meeting in New York on October 23, 2019. The emails discuss logistics for the victim's travel and attendance.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Attorney who emails the FBI and AUSA to inform them she has a new client who is an alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein and wishes to attend a victim meeting in New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the perpetrator whose alleged victim is being represented by Gloria Allred.

connections.description: Allred is representing an alleged victim of Epstein in communications with law enforcement.

events.title: Victim meeting in New York
events.description: A meeting for victims of Jeffrey Epstein being run by the FBI in New York. Gloria Allred's new client is willing to fly to attend.

locations: Los Angeles, CA 90048 (Allred, Maroko & Goldberg office at 6300 Wilshire Blvd., Suite 1500)
New York, NY 10007 (Southern District of New York U.S. Attorney's Office at 1 St. Andrew's Plaza)
keyFacts: Attorney Gloria Allred informed the FBI and a federal prosecutor in October 2019 that she had a new client alleging to be a victim of Jeffrey Epstein.
The new alleged victim was willing to fly to New York to attend a victim meeting scheduled for October 23, 2019, which was being run by the FBI.
The Assistant U.S. Attorney confirmed availability to meet with the new client on October 23 and requested identifying information to coordinate travel through FBI victim services.

The email chain shows coordination between a victim's attorney, the FBI's Victim Services/Human Trafficking unit, and the U.S. Attorney's Office in the Southern District of New York regarding Epstein case victims.
